sentence.Network_en: In Zoroastrianism, the elements are sacred and the body is corrupt.
sentence.Network_cn: 根据索罗亚斯德教教规, 大自然元素是神圣庄严的,而人的身体却是腐朽的.

sentence.Network_en: These ethnic groups that followed Islam once also believed in Zoroastrianism.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些信仰伊斯兰教的民族历史上曾信仰过火教.

sentence.Network_en: Bhavishya Purana explicitly identifies them with Zoroastrianism.
sentence.Network_cn: 未来往世书明确地把他们鉴别为琐罗亚斯德教徒.

means.word_mean: 1. system of religion founded in Persia in the 6th century BC by Zoroaster; set forth in the Zend-Avesta; based on concept of struggle between light (good) and dark (evil)
